Is there a function that takes a LocalContext and type: Expr, and produces a mvar with free variables corresponding to the ones in LocalContext and a given type?

The use case here is I have a TermInfo node from the parser and I want to create a mvar from it.

This doesn't work:

Meta.withLCtx termInfo.lctx #[] do
  Meta.mkFreshExprSyntheticOpaqueMVar type

where type is the expected type. In this case the generated mvar does not capture the LocalContext.

But I'm surprised what you have does not work (recursively follow the definitions starting from mkFreshExprSyntheticOpaqueMVar to see why). Are you sure termInfo.lctx is the local context you expect it to be?

Kyle Miller said:

But I'm surprised what you have does not work (recursively follow the definitions starting from mkFreshExprSyntheticOpaqueMVar to see why). Are you sure termInfo.lctx is the local context you expect it to be?

The way I'm checking it is that the termInfo.expectedType? is a valid expression in this lctx. Currently it references a non-existent fvar when I print goal on the mvar. However, this passes:

Meta.withLCtx termInfo.lctx #[] do
  Meta.check termInfo.expectedType?.get!
  Meta.mkFreshExprSyntheticOpaqueMVar type

Kyle Miller said:

Are you asking for the low-level docs#Lean.Meta.mkFreshExprMVarAt ?

isn't mkFreshExprSyntheticOpaqueMVar just a wrapper on top of this? I can just feed in #[] as the local instances right?
I've found the error. There was a panic somewhere in the program and it created the default lctx
Leni Aniva has marked this topic as resolved.
